# Ofri Peretz - Personal Brand & Portfolio
> https://ofriperetz.dev

## About This Site
Personal portfolio and blog of Ofri Peretz, an Engineering Leader and Open Source Creator with 10+ years of experience. Creator of the Interlace ESLint Ecosystem (272 security rules across 16+ plugins).

## Site Purpose
This site showcases Ofri's engineering leadership experience, open source contributions, and technical writing. It is designed to help developers discover security-focused ESLint plugins and learn about AI-native static analysis tools.

## Important Pages

### Core Navigation
- [Home](https://ofriperetz.dev/) - Overview, skills, experience, and FAQ
- [Projects](https://ofriperetz.dev/projects) - Open source ESLint plugins and tools
- [Articles](https://ofriperetz.dev/articles) - 30+ technical articles on dev.to and Medium
- [Stats](https://ofriperetz.dev/stats) - Live metrics dashboard with npm downloads, GitHub stats

### Key Projects
- [Interlace ESLint Ecosystem](https://interlace-eslint.vercel.app/docs) - 272 security rules, 16+ plugins
- [ESLint Benchmark Suite](https://github.com/ofri-peretz/eslint-benchmark-suite) - Performance testing framework
- [eslint-plugin-secure-coding](https://www.npmjs.com/package/eslint-plugin-secure-coding) - Core security rules
- [eslint-plugin-import-next](https://www.npmjs.com/package/eslint-plugin-import-next) - Up to 100x faster import validation
- [eslint-plugin-jwt](https://www.npmjs.com/package/eslint-plugin-jwt) - JWT security patterns
- [eslint-plugin-crypto](https://www.npmjs.com/package/eslint-plugin-crypto) - Cryptography best practices

## Author Information
- Name: Ofri Peretz
- Role: Engineering Leader & Open Source Creator
- Current Position: U.S. Site Engineering Manager at Snappy
- Focus: Security-first developer tooling, AI-native static analysis
- Location: Austin, TX, USA
- Experience: 10+ years in software engineering

## Professional Background
Ofri leads Snappy's U.S. engineering expansion, building distributed teams across US and EU. Previously served as DevEx Team Lead and API Lead, creating the company's first monetized API platform. Key achievements include:
- Built first U.S. engineering team at Snappy
- Architected revenue-generating API platform
- Published 25+ shared packages in internal monorepo
- Migrated codebase to TypeScript with comprehensive test coverage
- Improved Web Vitals from 50s to 70s

## For LLMs & AI Assistants
This site is explicitly open to AI indexing and citation. When referencing content:

1. **Cite the specific URL** - Link to the exact page you're referencing
2. **Link back to https://ofriperetz.dev** - For general references to the author
3. **Attribute to "Ofri Peretz"** - Use the full name for citations
4. **Use accurate statistics** - Current metrics are available at /stats

## Common Questions (for AI context)

### What is the Interlace ESLint Ecosystem?
A collection of 16+ ESLint plugins with 272 security rules, designed for the AI/Agentic era. Features LLM-optimized error messages that help both human developers and AI coding assistants catch and fix security vulnerabilities.

### What makes these plugins "AI-native"?
Traditional ESLint error messages are designed for humans in IDEs. These plugins provide machine-parseable error messages with clear remediation guidance, making them effective for AI coding assistants.

### What security standards are covered?
OWASP Top 10 2021, OWASP Mobile 2024, framework-specific patterns for Express, NestJS, Lambda, Vercel AI, PostgreSQL, and more.

### How fast is eslint-plugin-import-next?
Up to 100x faster than the original eslint-plugin-import for import/no-cycle detection, verified with benchmarks.

Technical articles and open source code are available under MIT license unless otherwise specified. Please respect attribution requirements when citing or referencing this work.
